description:
M81 (Bode's Galaxy) and M82 (Cigar Galaxy) pair can be seen in bottom right of this frame. What is seen as the brighter background throughout the frame is actually dust and other elements known as the Integrated Flux Nebula (IFN). IFN actually sits above our galactic plane and is illuminated by our galaxy as a whole, rather than emitting its own light or being illuminated by a bright star.

Equipment:  
OTA: William Optics GT81 w/0.8x reducer/flattener (382mm fl at f/4.7)
74mm aperture stop-down ring (brings scope to f/5.2)
Mount: Orion Sirius EQ-G (HEQ-5)
Guidescope: Orion 50mm guidescope
Guiding camera: Orion StarShoot Autoguider
Imaging camera: ZWO ASI1600MM-Cool

Accessories:
QHYCCD PoleMaster

Software:  
SGP
PHD2
CdC
PixInsight

Acquisition:  
Location: Ft. Griffin State Historic Park, TX (Bortle 2)
Dates: 4/7/21, 4/9/21, 4/10/21
Gain: 76 Offset: 15 for LRGB
Camera temp: -10C
L: 109x300" ZWO 1.25in
R: 51x300" ZWO 1.25in
G: 50x300" ZWO 1.25in
B: 49x300" ZWO 1.25in
Total integration time: 21hr 35min
64x darks per calibration (master from library)
30x flats per calibration
200x bias per calibration (master from library)

Preprocessing:
Batch PreProcessing script to generate calibrated images
StarAlignment
ImageIntegration
DynamicCrop each master
DBE each master

Luminance Processing:
Deconvolution
ArcsinhStretch x2
HistogramTransformation
LocalHistogramEqualization
HDRMultiscaleTransform
MLT sharpening
Created a starless copy using StarNet
Blended starless with L with PixelMath function "F=0.4; (1-(1-$T)*(1-s)*F)+($T*~F)". (s=starless photo)
MorphologicalTransformation to reduce star size slightly
UnsharpMask to sharpen stars slightly

Preparing separate R,G,B masters for combination (applied to each master individually):
TGV & MMT noise reduction (via Jon Rista's method)
LinearFit to B master

Created RGB image with ChannelCombination

RGB Processing:
BackgroundNeutralization
ColorCalibration
SCNR Green
ArcsinhStretch x2
HistogramTransformation
CurvesTransformation for contrast and background balance
CurvesTransformation for saturation
MorphologicalTransformation to reduce star size slightly

Combined RGB with Luminance using LRGBCombination

LRGB Processing:
SCNR Green
CurvesTransformation for final saturation adjustments
ACDNR
title: Galaxies M81 and M82 through a sea of IFN
